tool.name: Make
tool.help:
This tool creates a file with the sample names in a dataset in the order the spectra have been imported. It is useful for creating a factor file used in plotting and statistical analysis. Simply select a file with binned spectra and click *execute*. Download the created file, open it in a spreadsheet editor (OO Calc, MS excel etc.) and add columns next to the *Samples* column that contains the names of the samples in order.
'''EXAMPLE'''
To add two groupings to the file:
+---------+------+--------+ | Samples | Grp1 | Grp2 | +---------+------+--------+ | Smpl_1 | Trtm | Drug_1 | +---------+------+--------+ | Smpl_2 | Trtm | Drug_1 | +---------+------+--------+ | Smpl_3 | Trtm | Drug_2 | +---------+------+--------+ | Smpl_4 | Trtm | Drug_2 | +---------+------+--------+ | Smpl_5 | Trtm | Drug_3 | +---------+------+--------+ | Smpl_6 | Trtm | Drug_3 | +---------+------+--------+ | Smpl_7 | Ctrl | Ctrl | +---------+------+--------+ | Smpl_8 | Ctrl | Ctrl | +---------+------+--------+
.. class:: warningmark
Once the grouping columns are added save the file as **tab** delimited. Otherwise it will not work. The file can then be uploaded to the server as usual.
'''TIP''' All tools that use the grouping factor file and ask for a column number ignore the *Samples* column and start counting columns from your added one (e.g. Grp1 would be column 1).
